required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Multifunctional Cataract-assisted Retractor in Complicated Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Multifunctional Cataract-assisted Retractor in Complicated Cataract Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the safety and efficacy of a new multi-functional cataract-assisted surgical instrument with that of traditional cataract-assisted surgical instrument in cataract surgery with subluxation of lens.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Surgical success rate of operation with different retractor

secondary_outcome.measure: Successful implantation rate of intraocular lens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: implantation rate of intraocular lens with different retractor
Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) measured using a decimal chart Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) measured using a decimal chart

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day, 1 week, 1 month, and 3 month postoperation

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing cataract with lens subluxation surgery with Multifunctional cataract-assisted retractor
Patients undergoing cataract with lens subluxation surgery with traditional capsule retractor

intervention.description: Multifunctional Cataract-assisted retractor operation for cataract with subluxation of lens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of lens subluxation.
- Patients need to undergo lens subluxation surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active intraocular inflammation
- The intraocular pressure (IOP) was higher than 25 mmHg
- The endothelial cell count (ECC) was less than 1,200 cells/mm2
- Combined with other eye diseases
- Combined with other serious systemic diseases

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University School of Medicine
